blog.name: peculiarnation4u
blog.title: Peculiarnation
blog.description: Yellow, call me Osha and this is my blog. Here you will find trash, comics(maybe) drawings, and other stuff i like to make. Maybe just maybe people might actually like ma art

body:
Watching endgame

What i wanted:

. Carol meeting/interacting with the avengers

. Carol mourning fury’s death

. Thor and carol becoming besties( cuz he really needs some friends)

. Loki not coming back( i don’t hate him but don’t pour salt in our wounds)

. Thor getting over his guilt properly

. Hawkeye being sane

. Rocket and Nebula interactions

. Events of civil war being reconized and overcomed

. Each character who got snapped got to say at least one line

. Every character having emotional moments with those they lost

. Thor, Wanda, Carol, and Dr. Strange going ham on thanos

. All or none of the og avengers dying

.og avengers connection to the # of stones

. Pepperony wedding

What i got:

. None of that wth

. Irondad

body:
Bandai: S.H. Figuarts Avengers: Endgame Captain America Review

Bandai’s Captain America is awesome! I love this figure so freaking much. I’ve liked most to the Cap’s Bandai’s release in S.H. Figuarts, and the Avengers: Infinity War Cap overall was great, but this one? Kills it.

blog.name: idletladysiftopme
blog.title: Protectively Curling Around Carol Danvers And Sif
blog.description: Captain Marvel 2 and Lady Sif’s new show are the only things Marvel has left me to look forward to after the clusterfuck that was Endgame. Well, that and Guardians of the Galaxy 3. I will never forgive Taika Waititi for Ragnarok so if you liked that sorry excuse for a movie, I suggest you get off my blog. I’m always angry About something and currently it’s over the fact that Loki is getting his own show when there are so many other more interesting characters with untapped potential for expansion.

summary: An open letter to Hayley Atwell
body:
An open letter to Hayley Atwell

Hayley Atwell, if you’re reading this, I need you to understand that there was NO reason for you to have weaponized your fanbase against EVC the way you did after CA: CW. I don’t care if you were bitter about the fact that your show was canceled. The fact of the matter was that Peggy was treated a LOT better than most female characters in the MCU. Case in point, Jaime Alexander. She was unceremoniously written out of Thor: Ragnarok without so much as a name drop. She didn’t get to appear in Infinity War or Endgame, and the only mention of her character since her appearance on AoS is her dusted status on the Mcu wiki. And yet she NEVER felt the need to badmouth Tessa Thompson/ Valkyrie for “making a move on her man” or “replacing her”. And unlike you, Jaime NEVER got her own show on Netflix, appeared in as many movies as you, or was made the founder of S.H.I.E.L.D.

So really, you have no excuse for refusing to condemn the fans who were harassing Emily in the name of “Peggy’s legacy” and the comments you made that bolstered them into petitioning Emily’s removal from the MCU played a role in sidelining an up-and-coming actress from what would otherwise have been her big break in the MCU, whether that was your intention or not.

In short, fuck you, Hayley Atwell. You’re a shitty, excuse for a “feminist” and I hope you aren’t allowed anywhere near Falcon and the Winter Soldier. In fact I’d be happy if you never appeared in the mcu after this at all.

Hayley Atwell, if you’re reading this, I need you to understand that there was NO reason for you to have weaponized your fanbase against EVC the way you did after CA: CW. summary: What are your thoughts on the happy ending Steve got in Avengers Endgame?
question: What are your thoughts on the happy ending Steve got in Avengers Endgame?
answer:
Hey. Ooh my opinions and thoughts. yikes..lol

So the main reason I didn’t really enjoy it was that it seemed silly doing the fairy-tale ending considering all it did was create a bunch unanswered questions (alternate storylines, hydra, did everything still happen?, etc).

It’s not from the aspect that I’m bothered by a him going back to be with Peggy but almost like everything boiled down to simply to focus on a romantic subplot that happened a long time ago. Steve didn’t do the serum for Peggy, go to the war for her or become Captain America for her. Like we just lost two avengers yet we’re gonna switch gears and focus on what happened 70 something years ago? Idk it just didn’t fit the storyline to me.

I would have actually preferred if it had been left open-ended where you think he went back and stayed but maybe didn’t. :)

blog.name: madara-fate
blog.title: The Hidden Geekiness of Madara Uchiha.
blog.description: The name's Audric :) Male, 26, Tumblr-married to elite-kunoichi, and a HUGE anime fan, willing to talk about pretty much anything regarding anime and video games. Probably mostly a Naruto blog.

summary: Hey, Audric! Long time no see! :D Anyway, here's a question which I've been wanting to ask you after returning from my hiatus:...
question: Hey, Audric! Long time no see! :D Anyway, here's a question which I've been wanting to ask you after returning from my hiatus: what are your thoughts on "Aquaman", "Spiderman: Into the Spiderverse", "Avengers: Endgame" & "Captain Marvel"? I'm planning to watch "X-men: Dark Phoenix" hopefully tomorrow. And I'll spam you with another question, kukuku! >:D
answer:
Ah yes it’s been a while! I hope you’re doing well.

To answer your questions, I quite liked Aquaman and now that I’m thinking about it, it’s probably my favourite entry into the DCEU so far. I very much enjoyed Jason Momoa’s more human portrayal of Aquaman, and Amber Heard as Mera was arguably my favourite female deuteragonist in a Super Hero movie since Danai Gurira’s portrayal of Okoye in the MCU’s Black Panther.

Regarding Spiderman: Into The Spiderverse, I unfortunately haven’t gotten around to watching the movie yet, but I have every intention of doing so sooner rather than later.

As for the other two movies…

  • I gave my thoughts on Captain Marvel over here
  • And I gave my thoughts on Avengers: Endgame over here

Hopefully I’ll also be watching X-Men: Dark Phoenix relatively soon! 😁

summary: The Ideology of the First Order  I love Lindsay Ellis vids on basically anything (hell, I watched her Transformers series and I...
caption:
The Ideology of the First Order

I love Lindsay Ellis vids on basically anything (hell, I watched her Transformers series and I will never see those movies) but I wanted to share this because it makes a good point about marketing villains, especially in more recent times. The focus is Star Wars, obviously, but the argument spans franchises, and Thanos is definitely brought up.

summary: 5 Top Film Score Composers of All Time
title: 5 Top Film Score Composers of All Time
body:
A film is far more than what you can see on the screen. There are many specialties of film production that are routinely overlooked by critics and the public. You may know all about the actors on the screen but would you know – without Googling – what a foley artist does? A film director could be legendary but one may struggle to remember the people who comprise the editing team. You could…

View On WordPress

summary: The Secret Life of Pets 2 and Dark Phoenix Top the Weekend Box Office but Both Fall Short
title: The Secret Life of Pets 2 and Dark Phoenix Top the Weekend Box Office but Both Fall Short
body:
The Secret Life of Pets 2 and Dark Phoenix Top the Weekend Box Office but Both Fall Short #movies #darkphoenix

While the weekend box office did better than the previous year by more than 43%, the top two films both fell short.

The Secret Life of Pets 2 topped the weekend earning an estimated $47.1 million. It opened with the second widest opening ever with 4,561 locations. The widest ever is Avengers: Endgame. That $47.1 million is half of the earnings of the original film’s $104.3 million in 2016.…

View On WordPress

summary: Box Office: DARK PHOENIX Kills Off the X-Men Franchise with Worst Opening Ever
title: Box Office: DARK PHOENIX Kills Off the X-Men Franchise with Worst Opening Ever
body:
Fox’s #XMen franchise came to a grim end with #DarkPhoenix losing 1st place at the #BoxOffice to Universal’s #SecretWorldofPets2. The Beat’s analysis:

Box Office: DARK PHOENIX Kills Off the X-Men Franchise with Worst Opening Ever

Welcome to the Beat’s Weekend Box Office Recap!

The summer movie season is only partially into its second month, but I’m already dubbing it the “Summer of Blood ™.”

It’s not just that few movies are doing as well as my predictions, but few of the new movies –whether they’re sequels or original premises — are…

It’s not just that few movies are doing as well as my predictions, but few of the new movies –whether they’re sequels or original premises — are…

blog.title: Keep the S.H.I.E.L.D.
blog.description: female, isfp-t, huge Marvel and Captain America fan. Just an all around hyper red-head who's into YouTube, video games, anime- Your typical nerd stuff. (I survived the Tumblr purge of 2018. ...darn.)

tags: honestly makes it not fun to debate about characters
or even talk about a favorite character
or trying liking other characters when the fans so rabidly attack others
summary:
One post. Thats all it takes to remind me of why I actively stopped wanting to participate in MCU fandom. :)
There are just...
body:
One post. Thats all it takes to remind me of why I actively stopped wanting to participate in MCU fandom. :)

There are just waayyyy to many fans of characters that just wildly mischaracter the others in order to prop up their own fave.

This kind of behavior isnt exclusive to this fandom. It’s just…really horribly rampant in just about every part of this fandom. And it’s still annoying to see. (It used to be more on the down-low and you could ignore it. But now…)

reblog.comment:

title: Around the Tubes
body:
Check out some comic related news, and a review, from around the web in our morning roundup #comics #comicbooks

It’s a busy week as we’re focused a bit on the “comic” news coming out of E3 as well as our normal duties. Plus, there’s that pesky San Diego Comic-Con inching closer and closer. So, while we do our best to bring you all of the important news, here’s some from around the web.

Comichron – DCeased #1 leads May 2019 comics orders; Marvel’s new comics slate may be largest since 1993– For those…

tags: what really happened during the fice tears gap in endgame
summary: The original six during the 5 years gap
body:
The original six during the 5 years gap

What was exactly the effect of the snap on the live of the original 6 Avengers during Endgame’s six years gap? I think who often people forgotten to consider that when they call a character or another OOC in the part of Endgame in 2023.

Bruce/Hulk: Bruce had a very hard life earlier and a very bad relationship with his other half aka Hulk, believing who he was a monster. During the five years gap he decided to work on reconcile himself with Hulk and become only one person instead of two sharing the same body. In 2023 The new Hulk is a well know and beloved hero

Tony/Iron Man: in a very fitting way for his character the five years of the gap are most likely the best of his life. Tony is the Avenger who has lost less in the snap (because all his closest circle is still alive). He married Pepper, become father and lived happily away from the world. Only the reemergence of the guilt for Perer’s death (who was well buried and forgotten in his happiness) convince him to help the others with the time heist (and without Morgan his sacrifice in his last moment would never happen).

Clint/Hawkeye: Clint is the one who lost everything: his beloved wife and their three children all disappeared before his eyes. Maybe if he had not lost all his family he would be able to stay sane, but losing them all was the opening of the hell for him so he decided to go to kill the people who do not deserved to live because they were criminal bosses (maybe hoping to die at some point during this self-assigned mission). Still when Natasha reach him, tell him who they have a chance to bring everyone back he is healed, focused, regret his action and become the most determined Avengers in their mission. He will likely never forgive himself for not being able to prevent Natasha’s death but will be aleays grateful to her for everything (specially her sacrifice to allow him to return to his family).

Natasha: she lost most of the people she loved in the snap, plus Clint (her best friend and almost brother) to the darkness of his grief. She was grieving and destroyed and unable to move on from that loss and decided to dedicate her life to keep safe what remained of the world (and universe). She and Steve are clearly each other emotional support and she is truly worried for Clint. Natasha would do anything for returning the people lost in the snap and still felt guilty for her actions before joining the SHIELD. Plus losing Clint, Steve or any of her actual co-workers would be likely too much for her…

Steve: losing his world and friends once was hard, losing it twice was destructive. Again he lost practically all his inner circle (Bucky, Sam, Wanda, T’Challa, Sharon to the snap plus Clint and Thor to their own darkness). Still he tried to go on, helping people but he was go ahead on autopilot. In this situation, with only Natasha to keep him grounded to this reality, the memory of his great lost love and of the first group of friend he lost started to re-emerge and the grief for their loss mixed with the grief for the more recent losses. At the moment of the time heist he is barely holding himself and Natasha’s death is truly the last straw for him. He fought for saving his new world and stopping Thanos once-for-all but was really ready to die and too broken for living there after the battle.

Thor: he is the one who has lost the most in the latest years. In order: his mother, his relationship with Jane, his father, his friends, his father, many of his people to the hand of his sister, his world, then his adopted brother and his friend and mentor Heimdall plus half of the survivors of his people to the hand of Thanos. After all this he had the chance to kill Thanos, preventing the snap and failed. Around half of the remaining Asgardians again was killed by the snap, then they found Thanos, discovered he had destroyed the gem and this time Thor killed him, an useless kill who was the final straw for him. Thor felt to be a total failure and to be good only to bring doom to his people and his loved ones so he decide to isolate himself. He see beers, tv and videogames as the best way for use his time in New Asgard. Likely Korg and Miek are the only people he want around because they do not try to rescue him from his state unlike Valkyrie and the Avengers well they do not need to know what he is doing… Only after meeting his mother in Asgard and borrowing Mjolnir from there he returned himself but is still to broken (and maybe ashamed) for remaining with his people who in his mind deserve (and already have) a better leader than him in Valkyrie

summary:
Please try to not add any spoilers to Avengers: Endgame. I haven't seen the movie yet.
Now, I've found out it's gonna be a...
body:
Please try to not add any spoilers to Avengers: Endgame. I haven’t seen the movie yet.

Now, I’ve found out it’s gonna be a time-travel movie, so I decided to make this when I had the chance to. You can possibly take a guess of what this is from.

The words were made on May 25 on Fontmeme. I highly recommend checking out that site.

Also, according to TV Tropes’ “Wrong Time-Travel Savvy”, there’ll be a reference to Back to the Future. Ironic, that I have this in the BTTF style.
